intro: Gibbaeum ihlenfeldtii, commonly known as the Cape mountain sandthorn, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features small, spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained sandy soils. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
